dublin_core.dcvalue: The majority of persons with Alzheimer s disease AD are cared for at home by a family member such as a spouse or daughter Caregiving places enormous demands on these caregivers and the negative consequences associated with caregiving are well documented This paper reports results from the Miami site of the REACH Resources for Enhancing Alzheimer s Caregiver Health program that examined the efficacy of a family therapy and technology based intervention in reducing depressive symptoms according to the Center for Epidemiological Studies Depression scale among family caregivers of AD patients at 6 months and 18 months follow up
The effect of a family therapy and technology-based intervention on caregiver depression.
